name: Flesh Golem
description: A Flesh Golem appears as a patchwork of stitched-together body parts, with mismatched limbs and a face twisted in a permanent grimace of pain.
memorable: Notably strong and resilient, Flesh Golems are animated by unstable dark magic and can go berserk when damaged.
goals: Flesh Golems serve their creators without question, often acting as mindless guardians or enforcers.
relations: Often created by evil spellcasters or necromancers, Flesh Golems may be found alongside other constructs or undead creatures.
environment: Typically found in dark, abandoned laboratories, necromancer lairs, or graveyards.
strengths: Immune to many conditions and nonmagical physical attacks; can absorb lightning damage, turning it into healing.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to fire damage, which can lead to disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
attacks: Can perform two powerful Slam attacks, dealing significant bludgeoning damage, and has a psychic attack that can incapacitate foes.
most_powerful_ability: The Creator's Anguish unleashes psychic energy, dealing significant damage and possibly incapacitating nearby creatures.
senses: Has passive Perception of 10 and understands languages of its creator but cannot speak.
skills: No noteworthy skill proficiencies are mentioned.
additional_information: Has a Berserk ability that activates when its hit points are low.
Construct Nature means it does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
The Aversion of Fire ability makes it susceptible to attacks involving fire.
Immutable Form protects it from spells altering its form.
Magic Weapons means its attacks can bypass resistance to nonmagical damage.
test_queries: mindless servant created from dead bodies
brutal fighter that can go berserk
